recipes: I am abrim with vitality. If I devote some time to exercise, I'll benefit.
I've grown stronger. [I've gained Healt, but it'll be more difficult to gain further Health.]
The machine, my body, ripples with power.
I could carry a man across a river, now; or strangle him.
Exercise the Body: A Stronger Heart
I can grow no stronger, but I can improve my health.
My heart beats with the steadiness of a drum and the certainty of a judge's sentence.
I have picked up odd facts, here and there. If I spend time studying what I've learnt, I could increase my Reason.
My mind, the library. [I've gained Reason, but it'll be more difficult to gain further Reason.]
Knowledge is a city wall built stone by stone. But what waits in the darkness beyond the walls? Why would we need a fortress, except that we had something to fear?
I have reordered the boundaries of my ignorance.
I am a savant of secret wisdoms.
Exercise the Mind: A Busier Mind
Now I forget as much as I learn, but I can still gain Reason.
My mind is a paradise of mirrors, in which all things are clear, even those things I might prefer not to see.
I've glimpsed something wonderful, but I can't grasp it. So I'll seek it in sensation: the pleasures of sight, flesh and spirit. But all delights have their dangers.
I couldn't pay for the pleasures I sought. Another time.
Some mystics of antiquity sought wisdom in silence. I'm taking another road.
'The tigers of wrath are wiser than the horses of instruction.' Perhaps that's true. In excess I have become more myself.
The Vaporised Metal of our Will

Confusion in delight, and delight in confusion. In the rarer corners of rapture I have found a kind of light. Is it what I sought? [I've gained Fascination, which is a problem. However, Fascination can be transformed to Passion, with time and rest.]
I've neglected my studies, but I stand a little straighter.
The world is awash with printed words. Even the newspapers contain knowledge, sometimes.
The words contained knowledge. Now I contain it. It is a little like theft and a little like feasting and a little like the progress of an infectious disease.
If I proposed to learn anything, I wouldn't be reading this stuff.
I've passed the time. I have been inclined to tears, and afterwards inclined to laughter. Meanwhile, the world continues.
